alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jefferson; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:01PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Jefferson, northeastern Clark, southern Scott and eastern Washington Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 301 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Scottsburg, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Washington, south central Jefferson, northeastern Clark and southern Scott Counties in south central Indiana, including the following locations... Marysville, Henryville, Underwood, Otto, Paynesville, Nabb, Otisco, New Washington and New Liberty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
